data.title: Top Gun Glossary: Swagger Like Maverick
data.meta_description: Top Gun Glossary: Swagger Like Maverick
data.text:
Are you hoping to be a fifth-generation fighter pilot throwing around âGsâ? Before you go Mach 10 in a Darkstar, youâll need to know your A-LOC from your Ziplip so stand by to copy.

â

A-LOC - If youâre in the air pulling Gâs (see below) you may exhibit an altered state of awareness or A-LOC (Almost G-induced Loss of Consciousness), a term coined by the US Navy in the â80s.

A/A - Air-to-air. An aerial fight between two or more aircraft.

â

âAATIP - A program funded by the US government to study unidentified flying objects (UFOs) called the Advanced Aerospace Threat Identification Program. AATIP was made public in 2017.

Angels - Altitude measured in thousands of feet, so âAngels 4â is 4,000 feet.

Bandit - Enemy aircraft, a known bad guy.

Bent - If a piece of gear is not operating, it is bent. As in: âWolfman, be advised my radar is bent.â

Bingo - An indication of low fuel - 'Bingo fuel' - or a direction to head for the divert field: âMaverick, your signal is bingo.â

Blind - If your wingman is not in sight, youâre flying blind.

Bogey - Unknown radar contact. âInbound Mustang, your vector is zero-nine-zero for bogey.â

Bug - Rapidly exit a dogfight, as in: âWe got him. Heâs bugging out and going home.âÂ

Buster - Go as fast as possible. âGoose, your signal is buster to mother."

â

Are you hoping to be a fifth-generation fighter pilot throwing around âGsâ? Before you go Mach 10 in a Darkstar, youâll need to know your A-LOC from your Ziplip so stand by to copy.

â

A-LOC - If youâre in the air pulling Gâs (see below) you may exhibit an altered state of awareness or A-LOC (Almost G-induced Loss of Consciousness), a term coined by the US Navy in the â80s.

A/A - Air-to-air. An aerial fight between two or more aircraft.

â

âAATIP - A program funded by the US government to study unidentified flying objects (UFOs) called the Advanced Aerospace Threat Identification Program. AATIP was made public in 2017.

Angels - Altitude measured in thousands of feet, so âAngels 4â is 4,000 feet.

Bandit - Enemy aircraft, a known bad guy.

Bent - If a piece of gear is not operating, it is bent. As in: âWolfman, be advised my radar is bent.â

Bingo - An indication of low fuel - 'Bingo fuel' - or a direction to head for the divert field: âMaverick, your signal is bingo.â

Blind - If your wingman is not in sight, youâre flying blind.

Bogey - Unknown radar contact. âInbound Mustang, your vector is zero-nine-zero for bogey.â

Bug - Rapidly exit a dogfight, as in: âWe got him. Heâs bugging out and going home.âÂ

Buster - Go as fast as possible. âGoose, your signal is buster to mother."

â

Buzzing the Tower - A low fly-by pass close to the control tower at high speed. When Maverick performs the maneuver, the force created by his engine and the jetâs high speed creates an intense boom that shakes the foundation of the tower and everyone inside.

Callsigns - Nicknames used to identify colleagues rather than use real names or ranks. âGhostrider, this is Strike. We have unknown aircraft.âÂ

CO - The Commanding Officer, also known as Skipper, is the senior-ranking officer in charge of a unit, such as a squadron.

Delta - Change to a later time. âDelta 10 on your recovery time,â meaning the jet is now scheduled to land 10 minutes later.

Dogfight - A fight between two or more fighter planes usually at close quarters.

â

âEjection seat - Youâll need this handy device to propel yourself or an occupant safely out of and away from a distressed aircraft.

ELINT - Electronic Intelligence. Covert intelligence-gathering by electronic means.

â

â

F/A-18 - A type of fighter jet. The F/A-18 Hornet is a twin-engine, supersonic, all-weather, carrier-capable, multirole combat jet.

âFaraday Cage - An enclosure designed to block electromagnetic fields.

Fifth-generation fighter: Advanced US fighters are stealth machines like the fifth-gen F-35. A fourth-generation fighter would be an F-16 or F-15.

âFragged - The jetâs weapons are loaded. âDevil 501 is on station as fragged."

â

âFunky Chicken - Involuntary movements that happen during G-LOC (see below).

G: If youâre seated, youâre feeling one G (as in gravity) pulling you down to Earth. In a fighter jet, pilots can pull up to 9Gs or more during maneuvers like a strong nose-up pull.Â

â

â

G-LOC: G-LOC occurs when a pilot experiences Gs but doesnât successfully manage them, otherwise known as G-induced Loss of Consciousness.

â

âGrape - If youâre an easy kill in a dogfight, youâre a grape.

â

âHostile - A Bandit, where engagement is authorized.

Hypersonic: Anything traveling five times the speed of sound or more is hypersonic.

â

âImmelmann turn - Named after German WWI Eindecker fighting ace, Lieutenant Max Immelmann, the term refers to two different aircraft maneuvers - the first is used to reposition the attacking aircraft for another attack, whereas in modern aerobatics, an Immelmann turn (aka a roll-off-the-top, or simply an Immelmann) is an aerobatic maneuver that results in level flight in the opposite direction at a higher altitude.

John Wayne - To do a job the hard way or carry on with a task even if thereâs no automated system.

Knot(s) - Nautical miles(s) per hour.

â

â

Magic Carpet - Technology that simplifies the process of landing a fighter on an aircraft carrier, officially called Maritime Augmented Guidance with Integrated Controls for Carrier Approach and Recovery Precision Enabling Technologies.

Naked - Radar warning gear without indication of a missile threat.

Nugget - A naval aviator or flight officer on their first tour.

POTS - Plain Old Telephone System, used for ship-to-shore telephone-type calls via satellite.

âPOTUS - President of the United States.

â

â

RIO: Radar Intercept Officer in an F-14, Gooseâs job in the original Top Gun film.

âPunch out - Eject from a jet.

âRoger: Pilots say âRogerâ to confirm receipt of your transmission, as in: "Cougar, you hear that?â âRoger, Iâve got radar contact.â

âRTB - Return to base. âBig Eye, Eagle 301 is RTB."

âSA - Situational awareness. Perception of environmental events with respect to time and space.

Spike - An indication of a missile threat on the radar warning receiver. âViper has an SA-6 spike at two oâclock.â

Tomcat: The F-14 aircraft in the original Top Gun movie.

Touch-and-go landing (TGL):Â Common when learning to fly a fixed-wing aircraft, a TGLÂ involves landing on a runway and taking off again without coming to a full stop.

â

â

TOPGUN - A Navy fighter weapons school; an institution that develops and provides strike-fighter tactics.

âVapes - When your jet pulls a lot of Gs, it creates a condensation cloud. âWhen I came into the break I was vaping, man.â

âUCAV - Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicle.

âVID - Visual ID. Pilots may pass by closely and observe visually to determine the identity of an aircraft.

âWVR - Within visual range.

âZiplip - A no-radio communications event, including landing on an aircraft carrier in favorable weather during daylight hours
